description: Triangular array T read by rows: T(n,0)=T(n,n)=1 for n >= 0; for n >= 2 and 1<=k<=n-1, if n is odd, then T(n,k)=T(n-1,k-1)+T(n-2,k-1)+T(n-1,k) if k is odd and <=[ n/2 ] or if k is even and >[ n/2 ]; in all other cases, T(n,k)=T(n-1,k-1)+T(n-1,k).
formula: T(n, k) = number of paths from (0, 0) to (n-k, k) in directed graph having vertices (i, j) and edges (i, j)-to-(i+1, j) and (i, j)-to-(i, j+1) for i, j >= 0 and edges (i, j)-to-(i+1, j+1) if (i, j) is of form (2i+2h+1, 2h) or (2h, 2i+2h+1) for i, h>=0.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
